meanings.definition: To equip or outfit with new tools or machinery.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic was retooling his workshop with modern equipment.
meanings.sent2: The factory is retooling its assembly line to increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The carpenter joked that he was retooling his toolbox to fight off alien invasions.
meanings.sent4: She was retooling her kitchen with gadgets that seemed to come from the future.
meanings.sent5: The idea of retooling the old car into a racing machine excited him.

meanings.definition: To adapt or adjust for a new purpose or use.
meanings.sent1: The company is retooling its marketing strategy to target younger customers.
meanings.sent2: She is retooling her resume to apply for a different job.
meanings.sent3: The chef was retooling his recipe to make the dish taste like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The team was retooling their approach to problem-solving, thinking outside the box.
meanings.sent5: The students were retooling their presentation to make it more engaging.
